en.title: FusionExcel Supports Brunei's DPMM Football Club!
en.content:
REPORT FROM FUSIONEXCEL PRESIDENTIAL DIRECTOR RODERICK GOH. 

FusionExcel is very proud to be associated with DPMM Football Club or Duli Pengiran Muda Mahkota Football Club of Brunei. FusionExcel presented the team members with Quantum Pendants and Quantum Flasks in January 2009. Since then the Brunei Superteam has managed to win five games out of its first 6 outings in its first year at the S.League of Singapore! 

It now tops the S.League for the first time with 14 points after their emphatic home win 1-0 win against Sengkang Punggol in front of their ecstatic fans at the Hassanal Bolkiah National Stadium last night (24th March 2009). Gombak is second with 13 and SAFFC is third with 12. 

DPMM FC's Shahrazen continued his fine form when he scored the winning goal. 

Last night's win was crucial as DPMM FC will now play its next three games away in Singapore. 

Brunei DPMM FC secured its first point of the S League with a 1-1 draw against Young Lions at Stadium Jalan Besar, Singapore on 27th February 2009.

In its second game at Hassanal Bolkiah National Stadium in Berakas, newcomer Brunei DPMM FC fought valiantly to grab a 2-1 stunning home win against Super Reds in the Singapore League at Hassanal Bolkiah National Stadium on 04th March 2009.

It was indeed a special meaningful win for the club who was invited for the first time this season to participate in the S.League of Singapore.

DPMM FC continued their Cinderella story of an unbeaten run at the Great Eastern and Yeo's S.League following another 2-1 victory at home against Woodlands Wellington FC in its third game on 08th March 2009. 

It continued its unbeaten run with a draw against Geylang United FC in the Great Eastern - Yeo's S League at Stadium Bedok, Singapore 12th March 2009. 

It maintained its unbeaten record since the start of the S.League season, beating Balestier Khalsa 1—0 at Toa Payoh Stadium last 19th March 2009. 

“We will continue to work together with potential teams from all over the world to help develop sports as part of our mission and vision,” said FusionExcel Presidential Director Roderick Goh.
